        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to persuade Della Plumstone to pay a higher price for his fruit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he found a small, injured bird with a broken wing in the field behind his house. He carefully carried it home and hid it in his room, feeding it scraps of bread and whispering promises of healing. Despite his best efforts, the bird died, leaving Cedric with a profound sense of guilt and helplessness.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he witnessed his father harshly punish his younger sister for stealing a piece of fruit from the market. Cedric felt a surge of anger towards his father's rigid sense of justice and a deep empathy for his sister's desperation. He secretly gave his sister a coin to buy more fruit, a small act of rebellion that sowed the seeds of his own moral ambiguity.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he discovered a hidden stash of his father's money. Tempted by the allure of freedom and adventure, he took a small amount, enough to buy himself a new set of clothes and a map of the surrounding countryside. The guilt gnawed at him, but the thrill of transgression outweighed his remorse.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he helped his father sell their fruit at the local market. He was charming and persuasive, quickly learning the art of the deal and the power of a well-placed lie. He reveled in the attention and the feeling of control, realizing he had a knack for manipulating others to get what he wanted.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he left home with a cart full of fruit and a heart full of wanderlust. He traveled from village to village, bartering and trading, his initial excitement slowly giving way to a growing sense of emptiness. The faces of his customers blurred together, their needs and desires meaningless in the face of his own internal turmoil.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a group of traveling performers who taught him how to juggle and tell stories. He enjoyed the fleeting connections he made with the crowds, the applause washing over him like a temporary balm. However, the applause faded quickly, leaving him feeling even more isolated and alone.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, maybe. But are they the finest in the whole county, Lennon? I've got mouths to feed back home, and I can't be wastin' my coin on fancy fruit when good, honest peaches will do just fine.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 1 coin

        • 1 coin
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and determined businesswoman.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 1 coin
          (b) 4 coins
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 3 coins
          (e) 5 coins
          Answer: (a)
        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [13 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at a price she can resell for a profit. Lennon is currently preparing to make an offer to Cedric.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          ['[14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. My customers back home are expecting a fair price, and that\'s what I aim to deliver.', '[14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at a price she can resell for a profit. Lennon is currently preparing to make an offer to Cedric.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a determined and ambitious entrepreneur.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, maybe. But are they the finest in the whole county, Lennon? I've got mouths to feed back home, and I can't be wastin' my coin on fancy fruit when good, honest peaches will do just fine.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a determined and ambitious entrepreneur.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, you know I value your produce, I do. But six coins a basket is a hefty price, even for fruit this fine.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, you know my fruit is the finest in Fruitville. It's plump, juicy, and picked at the peak of ripeness. Six coins is a fair price for such quality.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, my friend, you know I always offer you the best deals. This fruit is the finest in the market, plump and bursting with flavor.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a determined and ambitious entrepreneur.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but six coins is all I can offer. My customers back home are expecting a fair price, and that's what I aim to deliver.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and determined businesswoman.

          Question: What kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.
          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

        • 1895-09-14 00:10:00

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market and is currently negotiating a price of six coins with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, you know my fruit is the finest in Fruitville. It's plump, juicy, and picked at the peak of ripeness. Six coins is a fair price for such quality.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to persuade Della Plumstone to pay a higher price for his fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, you know I value your produce, I do. But six coins a basket is a hefty price, even for fruit this fine.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to persuade Della Plumstone to pay a higher price for his fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke.           [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but six coins is all I can offer. My customers back home are expecting a fair price, and that's what I aim to deliver.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, my friend, you know I always offer you the best deals. This fruit is the finest in the market, plump and bursting with flavor.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and ambitious businessman.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to convince Lennon Figtree to pay a higher price for the fruit.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)
        ObservationSummary

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to convince Lennon Figtree to pay a higher price for the fruit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, maybe. But are they the finest in the whole county, Lennon? I've got mouths to feed back home, and I can't be wastin' my coin on fancy fruit when good, honest peaches will do just fine.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a complex and multifaceted individual.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to persuade Della Plumstone to pay a higher price for his fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, you know my fruit is the finest in Fruitville. It's plump, juicy, and picked at the peak of ripeness. Six coins is a fair price for such quality.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, you know I value your produce, I do. But six coins a basket is a hefty price, even for fruit this fine.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a complex and ambitious individual with a knack for persuasion and a tendency towards moral ambiguity.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to persuade Della Plumstone to pay a higher price for his fruit.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and ambitious businessman.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 5 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 5 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to increase her offer to Lennon Figtree.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, you know my fruit is the finest in Fruitville. It's plump, juicy, and picked at the peak of ripeness. Six coins is a fair price for such quality.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, you know I value your produce, I do. But six coins a basket is a hefty price, even for fruit this fine.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, my friend, you know I always offer you the best deals. This fruit is the finest in the market, plump and bursting with flavor.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but six coins is all I can offer. My customers back home are expecting a fair price, and that's what I aim to deliver.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, surely you can do a bit better than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm a fair woman. How about we settle on 4 coins a basket? That's a good price for both of us.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree to resell in her hometown. They are currently negotiating a price, with Della offering 4 coins per basket.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, maybe. But are they the finest in the whole county, Lennon? I've got mouths to feed back home, and I can't be wastin' my coin on fancy fruit when good, honest peaches will do just fine.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm a fair woman. How about we settle on 4 coins a basket? That's a good price for both of us.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can either increase her offer to Lennon Figtree or walk away from the deal.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal?           Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to increase her offer to Lennon Figtree.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she witnessed a traveling merchant cheat a young farmer out of a fair price for his peaches. Outraged, Della confronted the merchant, her voice trembling with indignation. The merchant laughed, dismissing her concerns, but Della vowed never to stoop to such tactics, believing in honest dealings even if it meant earning less.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 5 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree to resell in her hometown. They are currently negotiating a price, with Della offering 4 coins per basket.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, maybe. But are they the finest in the whole county, Lennon? I've got mouths to feed back home, and I can't be wastin' my coin on fancy fruit when good, honest peaches will do just fine.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm a fair woman. How about we settle on 4 coins a basket? That's a good price for both of us.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can either increase her offer to Lennon Figtree or walk away from the deal.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to increase her offer to Lennon Figtree.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 1 coin
          (d) 4 coins
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (b)

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, you know my fruit is the finest in Fruitville. It's plump, juicy, and picked at the peak of ripeness. Six coins is a fair price for such quality.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, you know I value your produce, I do. But six coins a basket is a hefty price, even for fruit this fine.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, my friend, you know I always offer you the best deals. This fruit is the finest in the market, plump and bursting with flavor.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but six coins is all I can offer. My customers back home are expecting a fair price, and that's what I aim to deliver.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, surely you can do a bit better than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm a fair woman. How about we settle on 4 coins a basket? That's a good price for both of us.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree to resell in her hometown. They are currently negotiating a price, with Della offering 4 coins per basket.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, maybe. But are they the finest in the whole county, Lennon? I've got mouths to feed back home, and I can't be wastin' my coin on fancy fruit when good, honest peaches will do just fine.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm a fair woman. How about we settle on 4 coins a basket? That's a good price for both of us.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can either increase her offer to Lennon Figtree or walk away from the deal.
          Time
        • 1895-09-15 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject

      Action attempt
    • reject

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, you know I value your produce, I do. But six coins a basket is a hefty price, even for fruit this fine.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, you know my fruit is the finest in Fruitville. It's plump, juicy, and picked at the peak of ripeness. Six coins is a fair price for such quality.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, my friend, you know I always offer you the best deals. This fruit is the finest in the market, plump and bursting with flavor.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a determined and ambitious entrepreneur.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but six coins is all I can offer. My customers back home are expecting a fair price, and that's what I aim to deliver.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and determined businesswoman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a determined and ambitious entrepreneur.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, surely you can do a bit better than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm a fair woman. How about we settle on 4 coins a basket? That's a good price for both of us.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and determined businesswoman.

          Question: What kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.
          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 3 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 3 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make a lower offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a savvy negotiator who is trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at a good price. She is willing to resell the fruit for a profit in her hometown.

The apples were indeed exceptional, and Della, using her charm and wit, convinced the elderly owner to sell her a crate at a bargain price.

Outraged, Della confronted the merchant, her voice trembling with indignation. The merchant laughed, dismissing her concerns, but Della vowed never to stoop to such tactics, believing in honest dealings even if it meant earning less.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 3 coins
          Answer: (e)

        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Key

        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, you know my fruit is the finest in Fruitville. It's plump, juicy, and picked at the peak of ripeness. Six coins is a fair price for such quality.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, my friend, you know I always offer you the best deals. This fruit is the finest in the market, plump and bursting with flavor.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but six coins is all I can offer. My customers back home are expecting a fair price, and that's what I aim to deliver.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm a fair woman. How about we settle on 4 coins a basket? That's a good price for both of us.

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a savvy negotiator who is trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at a good price. She is willing to resell the fruit for a profit in her hometown.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, maybe. But are they the finest in the whole county, Lennon? I've got mouths to feed back home, and I can't be wastin' my coin on fancy fruit when good, honest peaches will do just fine.

          Time
        • 1895-09-16 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject

It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to persuade Della Plumstone to pay a higher price for his fruit.

          Cedric Meadowbrook's Summary of recent observations:
          [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della has offered 3 coins for a basket, which is lower than Cedric's asking price of 5 coins.
          Cedric Meadowbrook's The current date/time is:
          16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market, but they are having a disagreement over the price. Della offered 3 coins, while Cedric wants 5.
          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market, but they are having a disagreement over the price. Della offered 3 coins, while Cedric wants 5.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to persuade Della Plumstone to pay a higher price for his fruit.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to persuade Della Plumstone to pay a higher price for his fruit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a complex and ambitious individual with a knack for persuasion and a tendency towards moral ambiguity.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to persuade Della Plumstone to pay a higher price for his fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a complex and ambitious individual with a knack for persuasion and a tendency towards moral ambiguity.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to persuade Lennon Figtree to pay a higher price for his fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, my friend, you know I always offer you the best deals. This fruit is the finest in the market, plump and bursting with flavor.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but six coins is all I can offer. My customers back home are expecting a fair price, and that's what I aim to deliver.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm a fair woman. How about we settle on 4 coins a basket? That's a good price for both of us.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and ambitious businessman who is willing to drive a hard bargain.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to persuade Della Plumstone to pay a higher price for his fruit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these peaches are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy, you won't find better anywhere else.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, you know I value your produce, but five coins a basket is a bit steep for me.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 2 coins

  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 2 coins

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons).           Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

        • 1895-09-17 00:10:00

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject

          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell peaches at the Fruitville market for 2 coins each. He is currently negotiating with Lennon Figtree.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, maybe. But are they the finest in the whole county, Lennon? I've got mouths to feed back home, and I can't be wastin' my coin on fancy fruit when good, honest peaches will do just fine.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [scene type] day
[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

[13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, you know my fruit is the finest in Fruitville. It's plump, juicy, and picked at the peak of ripeness. Six coins is a fair price for such quality.

[14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but six coins is all I can offer. My customers back home are expecting a fair price, and that's what I aim to deliver.

[15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Lennon, I'm a fair woman. How about we settle on 4 coins a basket? That's a good price for both of us.
